intro: Allocarya plebeia, commonly known as the common rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. Allocarya plebeia is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
